character.deck: Powerful magical villain who creates powerful illusions and whose powers are supposedly derived from energy given off by the evil exhibited by others.

first_appeared_in_issue.name: More Sinister Than Luthor! Craftier Than Brainiac! The Diabolical Dr. Supernatural : Finally! A New Villain Who Is More Than a Match for Superman and Supergirl! Watch the Birdie Supergirl! See How My Execution Buzzard Wipes Out the Mighty Superman!

character.name: Dr. Supernatural

character.deck: Holly is a member of the ESPeople.
character.name: Supernatural

character.aliases: Master of the Supernatural Sandu the Great
character.description:
Origin

Sandu, a mystical carny, was already gifted with extra sensory powers before Loki endowed him with mental powers that were over one thousand times more formidable.

Creation

Sandu was created by Stan Lee, Larry Lieber and Joe Sinnott in 1963 and first appeared in Journey Into Mystery # 91.

Character Evolution

With Loki being watched in Asgard by Odin and the rest of the Asgardian Gods, he needed to find a way to gain vengeance on his mortal enemy Thor. To do this he would have to use an agent on Earth to do the job for him. Not even Loki himself could defeat Thor so he increased the mental powers of Sandu over one thousand times its natural power. This would make him a more than formidable foe for Thor.

Thor, as Donald Blake, and Jane Foster visited the carnival that Sandu performed at but were unaware of the danger that was present. Sandu discovered the powers that were granted to him and immediately had sinister plans; thus fitting right into Loki's scheme. While Sandu began a thieving crime spree, Thor desperately tried to figure out who was responsible.

When Sandu became satisfied with the power that he had attained, he came out of hiding and fought Thor. Sandu quickly defeated Thor, chaining him and placing a building on top of him. Odin then sent the Valkyries to give Thor his belt of strength which allowed him to tunnel out and continue the fight. Through advice from Loki, Sandu managed to send Thor's hammer to another dimension but he became frustrated when he could not control it or even lift it. This allowed Thor to regain his hammer and defeat Sandu.
character.name: Sandu

location.deck: A mystical port hidden inside of a mountain which contains a wide variety of mythical beasts and magical creatures.

first_appeared_in_issue.name: We Were Trapped As Human Puppets

location.name: Port of the Supernatural

issue.description:
"Courting Disaster"

The special "Conflicts and Personal Issues" issue! Cringe as Alanna Wolff learns why Chase Hawkins can't see her! Shudder as Jeff Byrd gets himself in hot water with Harriet Beryl! Gasp as Mavis hits a roadblock in her love life! Giggle as Corey Wolff wards off a would-be boyfriend! PLUS: What is the hulking creature that's destroying property in downtown Brooklyn, and how does little Hank Klotz fit in the picture?

"Black Market Souls"

Wolff and Byrd go up against a mad scientist who's dealing in Black Market Souls. If you like those old Roger Corman movies featuring Vincent Price and Peter Lorre, you'll get a particular kick out of this issue!

"The World According to Chase Hawkins, Esq."

Alanna's main squeeze (and Jeff's first boss) is bedeviled by his own personal demons: creature comforts, mean spirit, and monstrous ego. A most unusual issue!

"The Strange Case of Mister Negativity"

He's bitter, he's angry, he's downright down on everything. And he's Wolff & Byrd's latest client: "Mr. Negativity"! Will his bad vibe undermine his case? Also, Alanna and Jeff represent a man who finds that his immortality leaves a lot to be desired! Plus: guest artist pinup, lively letters page, and more!

"Courting the Muse"

Wolff and Byrd represent a disgruntled muse who is tired of being used for more than inspiration! Also--now that the law offices have been destroyed by the rampaging Inevitable Hank, Mavis and Corey learn how difficult it can be to put things back in order! Plus: a cool pinup by Eisner Award-nominee Brian Michael Bendis!

"The Co-Inkydkinks"

A dream of a case turns into a nightmare, as Wolff and Byrd represent a psychic child in a suburban neighborhood. And when people come out of Jeff and Alanna's past to cloud their judgment, is it all part of a grand plan, or just an example of "The Co-Inkydinks"?

volume.description:
Prequel comic book spin-off to the TV series "Supernatural." Created by Eric Kripke.

Focusing on John Winchester where the show focuses on the boys Sam and Dean, the book is an origin tale beginning right after Mary's death.

team.deck: A team of heroes with horror-like roots, including Doctor Voodoo, Werewolf by Night, Ghost Rider, Satana and more!
team.description:
Brief History

A team of supernatural heroes that briefly joined forces against a common thread.
team.name: Supernaturals

team.aliases: Howling Commandos Paranormal Containment Unit Supernatural Threat Analysis and Kill Experts
team.deck: A paranormal division of S.H.I.E.L.D. assembled to deal with supernatural threats.
team.description:
Origin

The monster team known as S.T.A.K.E. officialy started with the name the Howling Commandos, a homage to the World War II team of Nick Fury. It consisted of a number of supernatural beings that were recruted by the global peacekeeping organization S.H.I.E.L.D.

Creation

The team was created by Keith Giffen and Eduardo Francisco and first appeared in Nick Fury's Howling Commandos issue 1 (2005). The team was originaly known as the Howling Commandos, a homage to the original World War Two team, but has since been known as the organization S.T.A.K.E.

Major Story Arcs

Beginnings

In the beginning, the team of monsters were recruted to stop extraterrestrial threats around the world. Their leader was Clay Quartermain. The team did a number of missions before eventually disbanding.

The New Team

A few months later, S.H.I.E.L.D.'s monster team was started again, this time renamed "Supernatural Threat Analysis and Kill Experts." The team was led by the recently returned-from-the-dead Dum Dum Dugan.

Other Versions

Secret Wars

In the reality of Battleworld a team of Howling Commandos was led by Mrs. Deadpool, Deadpool's widow.
team.name: S.T.A.K.E.

video.deck: Get a full description of what you can expect in the new series from Spurrier and BOOM! Studios.
video.name: Simon Spurrier Talks Spiders, Crime, and the Supernatural in WEAVERS

series.deck: Two brothers, raised by a monster hunter, follow in their father's footsteps as they travel the country saving people from the dark side of the occult and paranormal.
series.description:
Supernatural features stars Jensen Ackles and Jared Padalecki as Dean and Sam Winchester, two brothers who travel the country looking for their missing father and battling evil spirits along the way. Sam Winchester is a college student bound for law school, determined to escape his family's past - unlike his older brother, Dean. Ever since they were little their father has been consumed with an obsession to find the evil forces that murdered his beloved wife, in result recruiting and training his two young sons to help him in revenge. They have grown up as hunters of the supernatural. Sam escaped under the premise of going to college, and now has a happy life with his girlfriend, Jessica, and a promising future career. Dean, however, stayed behind with his father to join him in his "hunting". Dean goes to Sam for help when their father goes missing. Now Sam must join his brother to find him. His one weekend trip to search for the missing John Winchester becomes an ongoing quest after a horrible tragedy ruins any thought of a happy life for Sam. The two brothers, bound by tragedy and blood to their mission, travel across the country encountering terrifying and dangerous forces most believe to be nothing but superstition and folklore, such as the Lady in White, the Indian beast known as the Wendigo, Phantom Travelers who cause plane crashes, Bloody Mary, vampires, demons and many more. From Warner Bros. Television Production Inc. in association with Wonderland Sound and Vision, with executive producers McG (Charlie's Angels, The O.C.), writer/executive producer Eric Kripke (Boogeyman) and Robert Singer (Midnight Caller).

Comics

There were four limited-series comic books based on this show. The first three (Origins, Rising Son and Beginning's End) were published under the Wildstorm imprint, and the fourth was published by DC Comics after Wildstorm was absorbed into it.

first_episode.name: The Girl with the Dungeons and Dragons Tattoo

series.name: Supernatural
